title: Refilling Grain Drill with Pasture Mix/Oats/Red Clover to Reseed Old Pasture

tasks.task: Prepare and load a drill for reseeding a hay pasture.
subtasks: Adjust the depth of gauge wheels and disc openers on the drill.
Mix and sort different seed types (oats, grass, fescue, timothy, leftover wheat, clover) for the drill.
Handle and feel the seeds during preparation.
Calculate the amount of seed needed for approximately three to four acres.
Transfer saved seeds from previous spring to the drill.
Position clover seed (medium red) in the grass seed box of the drill.
Account for leftover berseem clover from previous wheat drilling.
Prepare to sell remaining spring wheat at half price to a neighbor.
Plan to plant corn in about two weeks.

tasks.task: Pull a grain card and trailer behind a tractor.
subtasks: Remove and check the grain card.
Attach the trailer to the tractor.

tasks.task: Adjust a tractor's settings for weeding sayang grass.
subtasks: Refer to the crop manual for gauge depth.
Position beside the tractor and operate the gauge adjust lever.
Lower the teeth to the correct depth (1.5 inches).
Lock the gauge adjust lever.
Adjust ridge spacing using the appropriate lever.
Set the driven axle (confirming it's fixed for this model).
Use the steering wheel to control the tractor's direction.
Test drive the tractor after setup.

tasks.task: Plan to assist with farm animal management.
subtasks: Learn to handle pregnant cows.
Aid in monitoring for calving.

tasks.task: Operate a tractor for weeding.
Familiarize oneself with operating a tractor.

subtasks: Check manual for correct depth setting.
Adjust gauge lever to set depth (1.5 inches).
Set ridge spacing.
Check driven axle (confirm it's fixed as per the track type).
Test drive the tractor.
Learn to assist with farm animal management (monitor pregnant cows, help with calving).
